intro: Desmopsis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. They have thick, fleshy leaves and stems adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Desmopsis species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
